result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryina R Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 8/01/2016; alternate 31 days jail. Defendant given 3 days credit towards fine, if not paid and alternate is imposed.
DNA paid along with fine on payment plan.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryina R Perez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ryina R Perez in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge in the amended Information. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine: 1355.50
DNA Surcharge:  200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to pay $25.00 a month commencing 08/01/2016 or alternate of 31 days jail. (Defendant given 3 days credit towards the fine if not paid and alternate is imposed)
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ryina R Perez in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs more time to finish his AODA and attorney Fragoso is requesting a 60 day adjournment. State does not object. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ryina R Perez in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a new date as his client is still in treatment and needs to complete it. State has no objections. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-11-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Ryina R Perez in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in AODA treatment Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to continue in is treatment program. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 02-08-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Ryina R Perez in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to compete AODA treatment. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 12-02-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Ryina R Perez in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs more time to complete his AODA treatment. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing at 10-12-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Ryina R Perez in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Defendant is in the process of enrolling in treatment.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 08-27-2015 03:00 pm
